Class BaseConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseConverter

  • public class BaseConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which is passed three arguments of the following form: [d1][d2]...[d(k-1)][dk] n m Where each [di] < n and represents a digit of a number expressed in base n to be converted into base m. m is an optional argument, but if left blank will default to 10. Output is of form [p1][p2]...[p(j - 1)][pj] where each [pi] < m, and represents a number expressed in base m. Digits and bases are converted and stored respectively as longs, so any m or n larger than the maximum possible long will throw an exception, as will some numbers where the sum of the digits is larger than the largest possible long.

      • BaseConverter

        public BaseConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • validArgs

        public static boolean validArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
        Retuns a false if arguments are incorrectly entered. The first argument must be properly formatted as [d1][d2]...[dk], and the program must be passed at least 2 but no more than 3 arguments. If any digit [di] is greater than the base to be converted from, validArgs will throw an exception.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Outputs [p1][p2]...[pk] to standard output
